properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 1:06PM EST until February 20 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterway in southern Indiana...

East Fork White River...

.Lowland flooding will develop on the East Fork White River at
Rivervale in the Bedford area Friday.  The river will crest
around 23 feet Sunday night, 3 feet above flood stage.

A little further downstream, at Williams, the river is now expected
to rise about 4 tenths of a foot above flood stage on Sunday.  There
is some increased uncertainty as to whether or not flood stage will
actually be reached however.

The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the East Fork White River near Rivervale.
* from Friday afternoon to Thursday February 20.
* At 12:30 PM Thursday the stage was 18.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Friday afternoon and continue
to rise to near 23.0 feet by Monday morning.  It will fall below
flood stage by Wednesday afternoon.
* At 22.0 feet...A few local county roads begin to flood and are
impassable.  These include Buddha Road south of the gage and
Lawrenceport Road.  All local roads across the East Fork of the
White River are threatened by high water, and some are closed.
Flooding of agricultural lands in Lawrence County is in progress.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
